Comment: You're right, but from the inside it's worth understanding that most people I knew, and most people they knew, believed most of us wanted to do the right things. We'd watch the nation fall short of our ideals again and again, but with the belief that we were trying to get better, and that the vast majority truly wanted to do better and be on the side of good in the world.  That view is fully shattered, even internally. And not  just for the people who are against MAGA -- the MAGA people themselves are bold and proud that they are not trying to be good. It used to be that the people pushing hurtful policy had some underlying explanation that they were working for the greater good in some ham-handed way, but there is no longer any pretense. They are openly hostile to justice and truth and anything of the sort.  So "you never were" hides a horrible transformation that has taken place. Before we were like a violent drug addict that struggled with themselves and tried rehab, had bouts of clarity and compassion, and cried for the people he hurt. Now we're hardened criminal that says "Fuck it. i'm gonna take what i want and if you get in my way you're nothing to me. I'll cut your throat and have a hot dog and a shake while you bleed out."

Comment: > youre asking for a civil war.  I think we're in this situation because we never really dealt with the first one and just tried to sweep it under the rug; few if any Confederate leaders were punished and they were able to live with their lives. [Jefferson Davis blatantly suggested that had the Confederate leaders understood what Reconstruction would have looked like, they would have never surrendered](https://jeffersondavis.rice.edu/archives/documents/jefferson-davis-speech-richmond-va). The Daughters of the Confederacy and the KKK have turned traitors into heroes. The confederacy may have disappeared, but the confederates never did.  It's been 160 years since the Confederacy fell, but I think there's a legitimate argument that the Civil War never *really* ended because the core issues that caused it haven't been addressed. Often, the descendants of confederates want the same thing as their ancestors.
